description.narrative: Central and West Africa continues to be characterised by protracted refugee situations and extreme poverty. Underfunding of many humanitarian appeals for the region has placed it in a precarious situation, adding to the risk of on-going violence, displacement and political instability. This funding provides humanitarian assistance to the region through the International committee of the Red Cross (ICRC), the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR) and United Nations Children's Fund (UNICEF) to provide protection and assistance to conflict and displaced-affected populations in Central and West Africa, specifically: 1) UNHCR 2010 West Africa Appeal: which has a focus on finding durable solutions for the approximately 150,000 refugees that are displaced across the region, including supporting local integration, resettlement, and return and reintegration; 2) UNHCR 2010 Chad Appeal: to provide assistance and protection of around 270,000 Sudanese refugees, 27,000 refugees from
